com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IBaselineConnection

All Superinterfaces:
IConnection, IEventSource
public interface IBaselineConnection
extends IConnection

Interface for allowing a client to carry on an extended interaction with a baseline stored in a repository.

Baseline connections are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on IBaselineConnection can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Since:
0.5

getBaseline

IBaselineHandle getBaseline()
Returns the baseline (auditable item) associated with this baseline connection.

Returns:
the baseline auditable item, which is never null
See Also:
IWorkspaceManager#getBaselineConnection(IBaselineHandle, boolean, IProgressMonitor)

equals

boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
Returns whether this baseline connection is the same as the given object. Returns true if only if the given object is a baseline connection for the same repository and baseline. Same repository means identical IConnection.teamRepository(); same baseline means same IItemHandle.sameItemId(IItemHandle).

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
other -
Returns:

changeHistory

IChangeHistory changeHistory()
Returns an object that can be used to access this baseline's change history (this is the change history of the workspace at the time the baseline was created). The change history for a baseline is fixed for all time.

Returns:
the change history; never null

configuration

IConfiguration configuration()
Returns an object that can be used to access the baseline's configuration.

Returns:
the baseline's configuration; never null

getId

int getId()
Returns the id for this baseline. The id is unique for each component/baseline pair. The id is meant to be shown to the user.

Returns:
the id for this baseline

setName

void setName(java.lang.String name,
             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
             throws TeamRepositoryException
Sets the name for the baseline. The operation has the following preconditions:
  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
name - the new name for the baseline; never null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

the comment string; never null

The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:

TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

compareTo

IChangeHistorySyncReport compareTo(IBaselineHandle otherBaseline,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Compares the change histories of this baseline to the given baseline and returns a report describing their relative synchronization.

The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if the client is not logged in to the repository. Operations on the resulting report do not use the connections or contact the server.

Parameters:
otherBaseline - the other baseline to compare this one to; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a report describing the relative synchronization of the two baselines; never null; the "incoming" and "outgoing" lists of the report are relative to this baseline connection; for example, if a change set is "incoming" it is in the change history of otherBaseline but not in the change history of this baseline connection.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

getBaselinesInHistory

IHistoricBaselineIterator getBaselinesInHistory(int max,
                                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the list of baselines in the history of this baseline. Baselines are considered to be part of this baseline's history if this baseline is built explicitly on top of previous baselines. In the very least, this result should include the component's initial baseline.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
max - the maximum number of results to return. The server can choose to return a smaller number for whatever reason.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a historic baseline iterator; never null;
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
